body.p:
Owingsville Ky
Decr. 5th 1860
J. W. Tate Esq --
Dear Sir
Accompanying this, you will find a -- petition of Chas. W. Henaker, &c, of this County asking the favor of the Governor to remit, the same
This is the petition of which I spoke to you of when I was last in your office: & I fully endorse evry word embraced therein as being literally true.
Please hand to the Gov. & ask him to remit. the fines if he thinks he can do so Consistently
His friends here will be perfectly satisfied for him to do so,
I am for my people & my peoples institutions

Our rights in the Union if possible, if not. Our rights are here, under the Constitution, I dont want to surrender the present Constitution; nor do I want to give up the Federal Government, If we have to fight lets hang on to the Army & Navy & force the fugitve slave law nullifyers to scorne

Truly Your
Friend
Jno D Burns
